page.title: 02NAIRN:SWIMMING POOL
page.content: Nairn Swimming Pool was rebuilt in 1980.Since it opened it has had a great response.Every day the average amount of people is about 100-120. The pool has got 4 clubs are:Nairn Amateur Swimming Club,Water Polo, Life Saving and the Tweeny Club. The Swimming Club has the most response with about 100 members.The Pool has 6 attendants.Apart from public times: Rosebank,Millbank,Cawdor,Auldearn and Firness primary schools and Nairn Acadamy use the Pool for swimming lessons.The price range for entry is: ADULTS-70p,CHILDREN-30p,O.A.P.and unemployed-25p.The pool does not have a diving pool or slide because of safety.The Pool is 25 metres long.The temperature of the water is 83'F.The pool has only had 1 serious accident since it's opened.Someone took an epeleptic fit in the water.
